Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: felt22
Reviews.Content: Good location and reliable property. Rooms are a decent size for a European property and the service is very good. Front desk staff was tremendously helpful and majoroity spoke English. Was in town with family and only negative was that the property didn't have a pool for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andreslegal
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a good move by Marriott, as a Marriott rewards Silver member I am very happy to see the inclusion of AC hotels in Spain. Facilities are great it all feels new and clean very modern. Definitely a great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for this North American business traveler”
Reviews.Author: BXC53
Reviews.Content: As the title indicates, this is from an American business traveler perspective. I'm a Marriott Platinum, so a Marriott affiliate was a natural choice. I'd compare this hotel to one of the upscale Courtyards in the US, with a European style, of course. It is definitely business oriented and I found good customer service from the staff. Several had good English and with my rudimentary Spanish, I had no difficulties getting good information on services and local food and transportation choices. Here are some Pros and couple minor cons: Pros: Very clean and neat overall- rooms and public spaces. Great location for local business and easy taxi or Metro connections to other areas. Free mini bar with beverages restocked daily Free coffee (espresso) in the room Solid WiFi connection (free as a Platinum, not sure the cost otherwise) Good buffet breakfast (also included in my rate) Good selection of soap, shampoo and other bath amenities. Cons: (minor) Soundproofing in the rooms could be better No pool or spa Bathroom ergonomics a bit cramped, compared with North American standards I would definitely stay again if my travels bring me back to the area.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rocks_to_travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the AC Cuzco in June of 2012 for 9 nights while on business. The hotel is located beside the main street Castellana. It is located in a business district not far from the Real Madrid soccer stadium. The hotel is best described as a business hotel, catering more to that than anything else. It is located about 50m from the Cuzco subway station, so getting around Madrid is quite good and convenient. The Madrid Metro is one of the best in Europe, clean and efficient. The hotel room was a good size and appointed minimally. The bed was comfortable. I was somewhat surprised that there was no safe provided in the room, nor was there a coffee maker or an iron. Also to my surprise (not that I sit in a hotel and watch TV) there were no English channels available. I used the laundry service and it was very quick with same day service. A taxi fare from Barajas International airport should run between 25 and 30 Euro, any more than that and you know the taxi driver took the long route (which happened to my colleagues). There are some excellent restaurants within a few minute walk of the hotel. There are also some great tapas places very close too. The breakfast at the hotel is quite good, with an assortment of cold and hot meat along with cereals and pastries. Taxi fare to the main part of downtown where the attractions are located is about 10-12 euros. There is a lot to see in Madrid with some great museums. The night life is great, with clubs open until 6 or 7AM. I recommend this hotel if on business in the Castellana area. I would have liked to see wifi included along with other amenities mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “American confort,spanish service”
Reviews.Author: Gaston22
Reviews.Content: The hotel has everything required by any traveler, rooms are very confortable though space available is by european standards, location is very good considering is not so close to Gran Via and surroundings, very close to train station from/to airport. Service is by Spanish standard which is probably the best in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Good Minimalist Decor, Seconds to Metro, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: L L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on two separate occasions. both times, the check in service was smooth and efficient. We arrived early and they got us rooms right away, before the check in time. Rooms are very clean. There are three adults in our travelling party and we found the beds large enough for three adults although two of the beds are two singles attached together for a couple, and they could come apart. If it didn't bother us. Like the Ac we stayed in Barcelona, this property also provided Free minibar that is stock with beer, water, tomato and orange juice. The fitness center provides water bottles even if it is small and the treadmill was broken on this visit. Unlike the ac property in Barcelona, this one did not provide snacks, tea or coffee in the evenings. For gold members like us, we are used to the extra perks and the ac property lacks the extras. having said that we were upgraded to a corner suite without requesting, and we're happy that the staff and supervisor tried harder and offered us continental breakfast in our room without extra charge in lieu of the breakfast buffet ( we paid for) we couldn't make because of an early flight. Checkout was a non event and efficient. Taxis are readily available. The property is seconds away on foot to Cuzco metro station, and Citibank. It is also within 5 minutes walk to nearby good tapas, restaurants and Irish pub. If you stay at this property, try the Tasca La Farmacia for a great dining and tapas experience within 5 min walk. The hotel staff can direct you to its location. They know this place well. the Cuzco metro station is 7 stops to the heart of the Madrid city! plaza de espana. It's only 10-15 euros by taxi to the Madrid regional Atocha renfe train station, and 20 to 25 euros to airport. Wifi is free in the lobby and free in the room for gold members. all in all, a couple of lacking perks for gold members but overall excellent property.

Reviews.Title: “2 Day Business trip”
Reviews.Author: dyfrank
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as it was special rate for conference/expo I was attending in Madrid. Hotel was great place to stay; clean, smart, modern; great breakfast; friendly staff. Wifi worked well and is a reasonable modest charge 12 Euro for 24 hours or free in public areas. Beds were also very comfortable It's location is approx 20 mins from the main International airport = 20 €uro; and approx 15 mins from down town = 15 Euro or there is a metro station close by if you are public transport savvy. Would definitely stay here again if the need arose.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: BosteroBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located. Rooms are modern and well kept. The hotel is lacking in a few areas: the gym is very small, and wifi does not work well at all. The staff is very helpful and the hotel breakfast is very good. The hotel is ideal for business travel but not for families as it has no play area, pool or anything special for kids. Overall decent but nothing out of the ordinary

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: chris324
Reviews.Content: We have just spend the weekend at Cuzco. After arrival we heard that our childrens room would be on another floor than our room, although we had booked two rooms next to each other already 4 months ago. Initially changing was impossible. After insisting and the language issue (the English of the staff was terrible) they arranged everything and we had a wonderful stay. Rooms were nice, free mini bar and a very modern look. Breakfast buffet was OK as well. For this price, I would definitely stay again .

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Burgesskpc
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant hotel experience from the moment we arrived. The hotel is very modern, cheerful, and attractive. It was clean as a whistle and reasonbly quiet. The location is superb, in that it is close to a metro stop and a bus stop. There was a mini bar with juice, water, and soda in the room. Don't expect in-room coffee, but that is a "Spain" custom. No problems with check-in or check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Very good well priced business hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoseLuisContreras
Reviews.Content: Satyed here for five days from Sunday pm to Friday am in April, 2012 The hotel is business orientated: the lobby is quiet, elegant and does not look like a train station with hordes of guest stepping into or out of massive buses. Rooms are well appointed, comfortable modern with a good space to work. Mini bar is stocked with soft drinks and are included in the room rate, so no feeling of getting ripped off for taking that water bottle at midnight that you get at other hotels. Lobby has a good bar and has large tables to hold a meeting or simply work with free wi-fi. Fitness room on the 9th floor is OK with one treadmill, one stationary bike, one elliptical a weight station and a couple of light free weights. Might get crowded in the mornings. Read other reviews complaining about noise but from within and outside the hotel, I did not hear it perhaps because I was on the 14th floor. Great restaurants at walking distance and a couple of girly bars in the vicinity which make the areas a bit seedy after midnight. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel to Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PSCLC
Reviews.Content: I Liked it. It's a modern Hotel with spacious rooms and good facilities. It's close to Castellana, near Satiago Barnabeu. There are plenty good restaurants nearby. Although I had stayed here for business, I'd recommend to visit Madrid, because you may find taxi's, bus and Metro at a very short distance. Breakfast is common (options are sufficient, but nothing that is relevant to describe). Highlights: comfort of the bed; free minibar; location. Lowlights: paid room wifi and few international TV channels

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for what I pay.”
Reviews.Author: mixalakh
Reviews.Content: I went to Madrid for a football match and so the location was great just 5 minutes walk from the Santiago Bernabeu stadium. The service was excellent the lobby was nice a bit dark but with a good taste and the room was really very nice. The room was very big and roomy with nice modern interior. The only downside was the breakfast which it was poor, otherwise my rating would have been 5 stars, so I put 4 stars. Another annoying thing were the door rooms that the majority of the occupants were letting the door to close as a result there was a lot of noise. I was really wondering, am I the only one that notice that you have to hold the door, so it will not make a big noise. Getting around with a taxi it is the easiest way, you can find taxi easily and it is not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, Free wifi is unreliable though”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveladdicts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and held a business function for 3 days in November 2011. The service, rooms, breakfast and facilities were great and sufficient restaurants for business lunches nearby. The only dissappointing and highly frustrating aspect was the wifi in the freezones which constantly was unavailable, something that the hotel must improve on.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Payka
Reviews.Content: Very good business hotel, located only few steps from the metro station. Very close to the stadium. Great for both business and pleasure. Nice rooms, great food. Free mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “State of the art”
Reviews.Author: virchow
Reviews.Content: This is a large and modern business hotel. It is stylishly furbished throughout. The rooms are big and comfortable and feature 20th century designer classics. Particularly pleasant is the dark parquet flooring. Although the hotel is located next to large thoroughfare Paseo de la Castellana the rooms are quiet. Staff is efficient, competent and friendly. There is a nice small bar in the large ground-floor lobby. The only draw-back is the not very central location. However, taxis were always at hand just outside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, payable services”
Reviews.Author: dvtraveler25
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at AC Cuczo in November. Positive: FREE MINIBAR which is refilled every day Very good breakfast Nice, spacious and modern room Good location (business area,15m from Cuczo metro station, 15-20 minutes from the city centre and 40 minutes from the Airport) Comfortable bed Clean bathroom Helpful staff Negative: No in-room safe No ironing setup only payable laundry service Only Spanish TV channels Expensive and poor room service Free wifi only in the lobby area, 12€ for a 24h card if using the internet in room Althought we had to pay for some expected services I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay for business”
Reviews.Author: MattyboyLeiden
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the hotel, there are some very good things about this hotel, the breakfast, the rooms and the proximity to the metro and airport were all good. However the problems with Internet availability and lack of basic things like an iron and ironing board made staying here problematic....also the service was on the grumpy side, I know not that uncommon for Madrid but some of the staff was too surly for me. Additionally the prostitutes walking in and out of the hotel, and nude bars outside, while I'm sure doesn't sound too bad for some, I found the area to be a bit too sleazy and would have liked all that to be a bit less obvious. Also sleep wasn't so good, the street noise below is quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: enriquecerveza
Reviews.Content: nice and clean hotel, big rooms, cool lounge bar service at reception could be better: very slow and they only speak spanish

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but flawed”
Reviews.Author: Bart J
Reviews.Content: The AC Cuzco is a very stylish, well appointed hotel. Staff are friendly, rooms are spacious and the free minibar is a nice touch after a long day's work. However the hotel location is very noisy close to a main traffic square, the 60 channel tv only does Spanish tv and the wifi in my room didn't work on either iPhone nor iPad. The hotel is also quite far from the main city centre. So unless you are in Madrid for business, my recommendation would be to look for another (AC) hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline A
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean room. amazing breakfast buffets, with wide variety of cheeses, hams, cereals, yogurts, fruits, and breads. Elevators are mini-tiny, but are fast, we never had to skip one. Personnel is very attentive and courteous!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: spindriftmonkey
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the AC Cuzco in Madrid on my way to Central America. I was greeted at the door and shown to reception. The check-in process was super efficient and I was in my room within 10 minutes of stepping foot in the hotel. My room was beautiful. Very spacious and modern with CD player and a selection of CDs, huge plasma TV, gorgeous toiletries and free mini bar. The only down side was lack of wi-fi in the room. I had to go and work from the lobby. That small detail aside, the hotel is located in a great area close to shops and the Cuzco metro station and only a 15 min journey to the City centre. Staff were all friendly and attentive and I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but check breakfast times!!”
Reviews.Author: IfitsMonday...
Reviews.Content: Good location, with shops bars and restaurants within walking distance. Free mini bar is a bonus. Comfortable room with all the mod cons and a large bed. But - the literature in the room states that breakfast starts at 7am. On arriving at the restaurant at this time, we were told it did not start until 8am. This was a problem as we had to leave the hotel at 7.20 to get to our business meeting on time. We were told we could order room service 24 hours a day, but this didn't help us on the day. 8am seems late to start breakfast for what claims to be a ''business'' hotel. I did not eat dinner at the hotel, but my colleagues had eaten there previously and were not impressed by the service or quality of food. Also free wi fi is only available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was not invited !!”
Reviews.Author: aslkjdsal
Reviews.Content: I'm a post-doc student and I was assisting to a scientific meeting. Because I was young and coming with a backpack, I was served like nothing. The gym was opening at 9:00 because their was room around ! Needed plugs to get asleep... However, the hotel has a good look ! AC is a done deal for me !

Reviews.Title: “Unnecessarily frustrating”
Reviews.Author: PuertoMadero
Reviews.Content: The place looks stylish, and rooms are ok for a business hotel, but service overall was not impressive. I needed internet and didn't have a laptop with me. There were 2 common computers - one never started, the other was rediculously slow with missing keys. Far worse in this regard than your average backpacker hostel. I needed to iron my shirt, but was informed there are no irons, only an expensive laundry service. Some rooms have more street noise than I would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: cobrandy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel for 5 nights and have found it to be a nice place. The hotel is modern in design, furnishings, and art. My kingsized bed is very comfortable. The breakfast buffet in the morning is very nice. The room service is the fastest I have ever had in a hotel. It's so fast that it's almost weird. (They did forget to put the ham on my egg plate two nights in a row, but...) The mini-fridge in the room is stocked with waters, juices, and beer and everything is free. That is a very nice touch. The fitness room is nice with modern equipment. Only 4 machines and one television, but it is very nice with free bottled water. The wireless internet is very slow and a bit finicky. You have to buy access cards at the front desk, so remember to do that when you check in. Also, they don't have irons in the rooms - actually, there isn't an iron or ironing board on the entire property! You have to pay them to lauder your shirt if you want it pressed before your business meeting. The location was great - seems to be close to lots of stuff and not too far from the airport. Staff is friendly and most speak English. I did notice that those taking orders for room service did not speak English.

Reviews.Title: “NO FOR FOREIGNERS VISITORS”
Reviews.Author: efernandez1947
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel for foreing visitors. The use of Internet is a nightmare. I had to buy prepaid cards for the use of the wireless service at the Front Desk to access the service provided by Telefonica. With two of the cards I got a message that those cards were being used by somebody else and therefore I had to make a call to Telefonica. Due to these difficulties I went to the Hotel's Internet Center: Bad news just one very old portable computer with six keyboard keys missing. What a nightmare!!!! The other incredible thing that happened was at my fifth day at the hotel. I got a call from the front desk requesting the payment of my bill because my "credit" was too high (Euros 1,400)

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious business trip in Madrid's business district”
Reviews.Author: lyonschelmsford
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with stylish furniture and nice fixtures and fittings. My room was freezing and even though the heating was on the maximum temperature it remained cold throughout my stay which was disappointing. The minibar was fully stocked and free which was a bonus. However, at 20 Euros, the breakfast was expensive and the staff not particularly helpful. For a business trip, I would recommend this hotel. However, even though the hotel offered free wifi to guests, this was only accessible if you were on the ground floor of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJS042
Reviews.Content: Very nice upgrade done to the Hotel - was there 2.5 years ago. Turned it into a very modern, slik Hotel with corteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “a good stay”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad2nowhere007
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. Nice and clean rooms. Free wifi at the lobby. here are a few small butt's: the free laptops in the lobby (good) are a bit run down (bad). The staff behind the desk is not over-friendly and have a kind of 'hey, i'm doing my job here' attitude. But all in all: I'd go again. (this was my second stay already)

Reviews.Title: “Was a great choice”
Reviews.Author: Mirage2010
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was really good, except that in 2010 they are still charging (a lot) for a wireless internet connection, and was not even a good one. Very old model that push the standards of the hotel bottom down. For a business hotel free internet is a must. I hope they read the comments they ask us to leave! The cleanness and quality of the rooms are really good, location is great just in front of Metro Cuzco, a little noisy cause of the streets but normal for a big city. Service was also good. I definitely recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We paid for the room, but we didn't stay there.”
Reviews.Author: Pepinillo2
Reviews.Content: Our flight within Spain was cancelled due to volcanic activitiy and we contacted the hotel when we realized there was no train, bus or car options for getting to Madrid to take advantage of our reservation. It was a Saturday night. When we first made our reservations some weeks prior to our trip, most other hotels we tried to book with were out of rooms. We thought the hotel would refund our deposit since the volcanic activity was beyond our control and it was likely to be an easy room to fill on the day of. Two phone calls to the hotel were less than sympathetic or helpful, thus the negative review.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Unless you need internet access”
Reviews.Author: stevemc75
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, friendly, helpful staff, reasonable rates, clean, good amenities. Only weak points are internet access in the rooms which is a real pain; almost a deal-breaker because I just couldn't figure it out (although you can get free wi-fi in the lobby which is what I resorted to). Service in the lobby cafe is also very poor (and I've been three times, every time the same).

Reviews.Title: “Noisey and Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: sPUD420
Reviews.Content: The street noise was unbearable. Sent my clothes out to be pressed, they came back like they hadn't been touched.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexC_RO
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night, while on a business trip. After very quick check-in process I went up to the room, 710. The room was spacious enough, with a king bed, sofa and desk for work. LCD TV with many channels but mostly in Spanish, bathroom equiped with more ammenities that you would imagine, from regular shower stuff to razor, comb, shoe-shine, etc. Only thing missing from the room was an iron machine, which is strange for a business hotel. On the floor the room did not have a carpet, but a new wooden floor, a bit too "cold" for my taste. Breakfast is served on first floor in an area which looks more like a corridor, but the food is good and the orange juice is fresh. For a business trip or short leisure stay, it's a very good hotel. I payed 90 EUR+VAT, and for the money I received very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality business hotel”
Reviews.Author: loobylooLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really lovely. It is directly by the metro so easy to travel to/from but a little away from the touristy and fun parts of the city. I couldnt fault the room or the amazing breakfast buffet. I didnt use any other amenities but would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy and nice hotel with very good service”
Reviews.Author: lenachrista
Reviews.Content: The AC Cuzco is a very fancy hotel, however it is still cosy and the service was excellent. Would recommend it for leisure travels aswell as business travels.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay - nice and safe for a lone traveller.”
Reviews.Author: SalesTrainer
Reviews.Content: There was no English TV and no pay TV, so you have to make do Spanish TV and you need to contact reception to arrange the internet connection. Food was quite expensive, though the room service was fast and efficient. The mini bar in your room at this hotel is free and is packed with water and juice. Never used the gym, but had a look and it looked good. Didn't eat in the restuarant or use the bar, as I normally do when working away from home, as it seems to be a place for business meetings, and I felt a bit out of place as I was there myself. A few local restaurants within close proximity of the hotel, (including Burger King) though the Spanish team I worked with out there didn't recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: carpediem1311
Reviews.Content: Great room, breakfast was good, internet Wifi available for 12 Euros per day. A few steps from a subway exit, be aware that on sunday everything around is closed! You have a nearby Burger King or Vips (good meals!).

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonathanjo
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable business hotel with some nice touches close to the Bernabeu Stadium . It is also right next to the Cuzco metro station which is very convenient for the airport but somewhat less so if you want to go into the city. Modern furniture, good bed, very clean. Staff at the reception are very friendly but the bar staff are a bit dozy. Breakfast is very good although the coffee & tea seems to be served by the same people that staff the bar! Free mini-bar is great - a couple of bottles of water, a beer, some soda - why can't more hotels do this? Wifi is EUR12 a day which is better than some, but still a RIP OFF. I stay here regularly because it is very close to our Madrid office. I would not recommend for tourists, there are plenty of other hotels to chose from that are much closer to the city. If you do stay here, there are some good untouristy restaurants in the neighbourhood. I like Maria Pita and El Olivio, and for the best Jamon Iberico de Bellota and Lomo try La Dorada but remember to take plenty of Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place But Out of the Way”
Reviews.Author: HonkHonk
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a very nice hotel. The location is near train station but is otherwise out of the way for tourists. I was there on business and it was a long way to the convention center and to the old part of town. My room smelled a bit like an old campfire, kind of smokey but not like cigarettes. The staff was very helpful, as I do not speak Spanish and had some trouble communicating. They have a massive breakfast spread that comes with the room cost. No TV stations with English except one British news station, so no TV for English speakers. Overall, I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Sub par family rooms”
Reviews.Author: Spearsoid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while on a tour of Spain. Though the lobby was somewhat grand and stylish, I was disappointed with the room quality. I was with both my parents and the only rooms they had for three or more people were interior rooms that were dark and faced the opposite side of the building only a few feet away. We tried to get two smaller rooms on the exterior, but they would total 114 dollars a night more. This is not a bad hotel if you're traveling alone or with only one other person, but I would definitely not recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Nice Service, bleh location”
Reviews.Author: ecortez01
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, modern hotel in Madrid's northern business district (near the Santiago Bernabeu stadium). Decent service, gorgeous rooms, and not a bad location really--a few km north of the main attractions, but right on a Metro line.

Reviews.Title: “Fine apart from the smoke and the noise”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire-resident
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as part of a meeting I attended in the conference centre nearby. Check in was efficient and the room itself was a good size with a comfortable bed, a decent sized sofa and a good desk area. Unfortunately the television was not visible from the sofa and both of the clocks in the room showed the wrong time. The bathroom was also spacious with an excellent selection of toiletries and other bathroom requisites. Excellent and very quiet air conditioning. The downsides were the noise - ask for a room at the back of the building because in the rooms at the front of the hotel the traffic noise is audible even though the windows are double glazed and Madrid drivers seem to use their horns much more than UK drivers do. I wasn't given a choice of smoking or non-smoking rooms and ended up in a smoking one, which didn't really smell too badly, but the corridor outside the room stank of smoke, which was unpleasant. The Buffet breakfast was good and items seemed to be replaced regularly at busy periods. Overall a perfectly good business hotel, but it would have been better without the smoke and the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to Cuzco”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel whilst attending a business meeting - was very pleasantly surprised. Cannot comment on the location as it was one of those airport-hotel-airport meetings. However the hotel was spotless and very modern in design- and most importantly - everything worked. The rooms were large with state of the art CD/MP4 players and plasma screens and wireless internet (not free but reasonable). Bathrooms spacious and had a wide range of toiletries and a great shower. Would recommend it for business where you want functionality in a reasonably priced slick and comfortable package.

Reviews.Title: “Was stunned at the bad service”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkShutterbug
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were quite pleasant if you like the modern style and the location was very convenient to the financial district, the service was atrocious. It seemed as if the answer to every request was "no" and then, if pressed, sometimes quite hard, the response would become "yes." The staff whether at the front desk, the restaurant or in the bar were rude and unresponsive. It took 20 minutes to get a cup of coffee one morning because there "weren't enough people in the restaurant to serve." Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing, poor location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: tripzzzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AC Cuzco for five days. The property is located in the business/financial district of Madrid which is on the opposite side of town from most all of the tourist attractions. You either have to take an expensive cab ride to and from the hotel, or take a 25-30 minute metro ride, changing lines, to reach the Plaza areas. The front desk will tell you it is 10 minutes, not true. Our hotel room was 200 EU per night. The room was modern and spacious, but no charm whatsoever, again it is a business hotel. Those looking for ambiance should look elsewhere. My major complaint with the hotel however and believe me it is a MAJOR COMPLAINT, is the rudeness and lack of customer service of the staff. Everyone we spoke with from the front desk to the resaurant bar had a serious attitude problem which really made the entire hotel portion of our trip unenjoyable. If I was able to have changed hotels, I would have done so, but for business reasons, we needed to stay here. If you are visiting Madrid as a tourist, this is definitely not the place to stay. You can find much nicer hotels, much closer to the center of town for the same price or less. As a business client, I thought it pretty ridiculous that they charged you for internet access. This should be included as a basic service in this type of hotel property and is another "fly in the ointment " in the overall AC Cuzco experience. I seriously suggest that you stay elsewhere wheter on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Four Circles for Three Stars”
Reviews.Author: TBone_CA
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice - all of what you need and none of what you don't need when on business. Much better choice than many 4-star hotels in Madrid with hefty prices and attitude. PROS: Location, Cost, Room Design and Size, Fast and Reasonable Laundry Service, Friendly Staff, Good Breakfast Buffet, Good Value for the Cost. CONS: Would like W-LAN included in price instead of buying time. CANT COMMENT ON: Room Service or Fitness Room.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspiring”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Cuzco is a basic business hotel in the heart of the financial district in Madrid. There is no reason I can think of to stay here if you are a tourist, except if maybe you are a devoted fan of the Real Madrid soccer team whose stadium is nearby. The food in the restaurant is truly dreadful but thankfully there is much better on offer within 100 yards. The staff are OK, but you need to speak Spanish if you want anything other than the basics. The rooms are clean and spacious but charmless. Be warned that during the Spanish holiday season in July and August, many of the hotel facilities (such as the bar) will be closed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...AVOID the hotel restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is a very nice place to stay-- good location (on the same block as Plaza de Castellana metro), nice rooms, amiable front desk staff...I am overwhelmingly disappointed with my memories of a late lunch in the hotel restaurant. I was served a piece of beef that was absolutely the toughest I had ever encountered. It was not edible. Upon requesting a plate change, the waiter, who was also the restaurant manager...sternly informed me that there must have been something wrong with my teeth, and that the meat was perfection. Needless to say...that was NOT the most appropriate way to approach a restaurant patron. I am well aware that customer service in Spain is on a very different level and is unregulated by an authority...however, the service that I received was deplorable. Instead of eating in the hotel restaurant, I would instead highly recommend Casa Paco in the Plaza de Espana...excellent beef (and service) there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at Madrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I ever stay in this hotel when I stay in Madrid. Very easy to find. Good underground access. Near to Santiago Bernabeu Stadion of Real Madrid. Very clean rooms.
